cards.desc:
# Description

## Issue

Good morning Lucy, Melissa,
 
I hope that you are well. 
 
I am afraid that when the guests book through opentable for the deal, they receive an email confirmation about the deal and on our system it is flagged.
 
But, if the guest then goes back into their booking on opentable and changes the time, in our system the deal disappears.
 
We have tested this several times to double check and I am afraid that we always get the same result.
 
I look forward to hearing back from you.
 
With kind regards, 

## Workaround

Hi Lucy,
 
This is a known issue. The temporary workaround is for the customer to cancel the reservation and rebook. They’ll then be able to select the offer. I’ll have to talk to Miwa & Mattia for a more permanent fix
 
Regards,
Arca
cards.name: issue when updating booking time w/ offer

cards.desc:
# Description

Hello all,

We're seeing some odd numbers and a very large discrepancy when we at the inventory availability through DFP compared to the Adobe site level reports.

Per Adobe reporting, it looks like there are 5-6MM PV on Desktop, and 3MM PV on Mobile.  

DESKTOP
When I pull the impression availability in DFP, I see only 1.4MM available impressions in the 300x100 which should be on all pages except for the Complete Reservation page.  We're somehow not filling, or missing tags on ~3MM page views on desktop.  

MOBILE
We're seeing a similar issue with mobile as well.  On Mobile, I see only 400K available impressions, but given that the ad should be on the Rest Prof and Confirm page, we should be seeing more available impressions?  

Given that these are large discrepancies, I'd love to figure out a solution as soon as possible.

Can you confirm that the tags are indeed on every page?  

Would it be possible to set up a dev log in or similar so I can inspect the ad tag on page, to ensure it's functioning correctly?  The current set up does not allow me to view the source ad tag.

We're also open to any suggestions you might have so that we can resolve.

Let me know if I can assist with anything as well.

Thank you!
cards.name: Reporting Discrepancy

Acceptance tests run against a dedicated instance of the service along with a dedicated MongoDB box, which is a maintenance overhead.

One approach could be to host the service in-memory and run the tests against it. That way, we don't have to maintain a dedicated box for those tests.

There's a dedicated MongoDB instance hosted in PP. We can use a docker container instead. Docker-Compose could be used to bring both the service instance and the DB together in an integrated manner

A script on the page calculates how many promo boxes we have and therefore the required width of the container box. However before the script has fully loaded the container has a width of 9000px (`.grid-scroller-row`). The final promo box in this container is right aligned so before the fixed width has been set by JS this last box is off screen.

This could also be causing the problem in this ticket if the parent width is too narrow.

From: Matt Reed
Date: Thursday, 28 January 2016 at 19:45
To: Nicky Drake
Cc: John Catterfeld
Subject: "Make a reservation" implementation request

Hey Nicky,

There’s a long-running test that we need to get into the codebase. I know you’ve been doing some changes to the copy and it looks like John’s team has done the work so I was hoping you guys could create a ticket for this so we don’t have clashing tests anymore (see attached screenshot - if you dare!). There was a previous test that also clashed pretty hard that I emailed you guys about.

Changes
New users only see: “Instant confirmation” below “Make a free reservation"
Add the word “Free.” This matches our language on Start and Home that also saw a lift to conversion.

Test data: V3 https://app.optimizely.com/results2?experiment_id=3196090127
This test represents nearly $500k in annualized incremental revenue

Matt

cards.desc:
The existing SCSS variable - `$spacing-extra-small` - is wrong. The naming convention is inconsistent and it's actually bigger than `$spacing-small`.  We want to deprecate this variable and use `$spacing-smaller` instead.

Replace all uses of `$spacing-extra-small` with `$spacing-smaller`.

https://github.com/search?p=1&q=%24spacing-extra-small+user%3Aopentable&ref=searchresults&type=Code&utf8=%E2%9C%93
cards.name: Replace extra-small variable name with smaller [XS]

cards.desc:
in order to have a deep-linking against a promo page a well formed QS should have *m* as metro id parameter and *pid* as promo id parameter:

when we operate on the DTP although the query string changes m into metroid and pid in promoid and this prevents deep linking to work properly.

if in fact we copy and paste the link in another browser we are not able to see the same result

deep linking NOT working (when filtering using the DTP):
http://www.opentable.co.uk/promo.aspx?metroid=72&sort=Popularity&excludefields=Description&promoid=816&ref=13256&pricebandids=2
 
deep linking working:
http://www.opentable.co.uk/promo.aspx?m=72&sort=Popularity&excludefields=Description&pid=816&ref=13256&pricebandids=2

- add a card to the backlog

- add the "missing acceptance criteria" sticker to the card (see above)

- remove the "missing acceptance criteria" sticker once acceptance criteria has been added to a card

- before moving the card into the **This sprint (prioritised)** or the **In progress column** make sure it has the "acceptance criteria" checklist (see example below)

- when the card is in the **Awaiting sign-off** column the person responsible for validating it should verify and check all the criteria before moving it into **Completed**

Thanks.
 
Bryce
 
 
From: Nicky Drake <ndrake@opentable.com>
Date: Wednesday, January 6, 2016 at 12:56 PM
To: Nagesh Challapalli <nchallapalli@opentable.com>, Cormac Twomey <ctwomey@opentable.com>, Bryce Catlin <bcatlin@opentable.com>, Ryan Tomlinson <rtomlinson@opentable.com>, Michael Wallett <mwallett@opentable.com>, Arca Artem <aartem@opentable.com>, Larry Quantz <lquantz@opentable.com>
Cc: Martin Schwitzner <mschwitzner@opentable.com>, Arca Artem <aartem@opentable.com>, John Catterfeld <jcatterfeld@opentable.com>
Subject: Re: Help needed: OpenTable's Google Static Map usage causing warnings
 
HI Nagesh,
 
We’re shutting down Request Bookings on Monday 11th Jan – all restaurants will be switched to listings so if the issue is on he confirmation page it will stop happening on Monday. On this basis is there any big urgency to the issue? Should we invest time fixing it for the sake for 3-4 days?
 
Nicky
 
From: Nagesh Challapalli
Date: Wednesday, 6 January 2016 at 20:04
To: Cormac Twomey, Bryce Catlin, Ryan Tomlinson, Michael Wallett, Arca Artem, Larry Quantz
Cc: Nicky Drake
Subject: Re: Help needed: OpenTable's Google Static Map usage causing warnings
 
Hi Cormac, 
 
Researching on the static google map calls, its seems these calls are being made by Request Booking site when completing the reservation process. There is a separate microsite for request booking that handles these calls. 
 
I am not sure about the warnings and I guess we need more insights into these warnings from google. 
 
I will continue looking at other failures but wanted to update on this first as its high on the list. 
 
Thanks,
Nagesh
 

From: Cormac Twomey
Sent: Tuesday, January 05, 2016 10:11 AM
To: Nagesh Challapalli; Bryce Catlin
Subject: FW: Help needed: OpenTable's Google Static Map usage causing warnings
 
Nagesh, see the attachments which I think point the finger at legacy booking flow?
 
—Cormac
 
From: Clyde Li <clyde.li@booking.com>
Date: Tuesday, January 5, 2016 at 9:19 AM
To: Bryce Catlin <bcatlin@opentable.com>, Cormac Twomey <ctwomey@opentable.com>, Ryan Tomlinson <rtomlinson@opentable.com>
Subject: Help needed: OpenTable's Google Static Map usage causing warnings
 
Hello colleagues at OpenTable,
 
My name is Clyde Li and I work in IT Front-end Maps team at Booking.com. 
 
We recently received an email from Google [attached below], mentioning that we are generating warnings with the static map API. Since all Priceline group’s websites are under the same client ID at Google, the warnings report also contains malformed request urls on opentable.com. Hence your help is needed to solve this issue. 
 
We got in contact with Google, and received this warning log sample.
cards.name: Investigate why the Request Booking site throws up erros on the Google Static Map API

cards.desc:
Some request booking restaurants are failing to show dtp because hours of operation are not formatted correctly.

Want to write a basic script (to begin with) within the request bookings project to resolve this.

- Use search api to find different restaurants e.g. http://search-api-ln.otenv.com/restaurants/edge/?domain=de&size=1000&metroid=239&Features.IncludeRequestBookings=true,
- Filter those without a WeeklySchedule i.e. it is null,
- Read out hours of operation from restaurant api e.g. http://restaurant-ln.otenv.com/v8/restaurants/109965,
- Combine them.
cards.name: [OMG-97] Automatically find restaurants without weekly schedule

Cc: Nicky Drake, Jeremy Barry, OMG
Subject: Re: Date/Time Field

Works for me! I can get the new fields created today and let you know their names – then you guys can work on the rest of it on your schedule.

-AB

---

From: Marcin Bazydlo 
Date: Monday, October 26, 2015 at 7:30 AM
To: Andrew Barash, Martin Schwitzner, Arca Artem
Cc: Nicky Drake, Jeremy Barry, OMG
Subject: Re: Date/Time Field

CC: OMG

We already receive them from users as separate date and time so splitting is no issue. If that is preferred from any point of view then we should go for it as for RB microsite it really doesn't matter.

The only thing that I am worried is how to roll it out. There are at least 3 bits that should be updated at the same time:

1. RB microsite

2. Salesforce

3. Email templates

My suggested approach would be to create new set of fields in SF (hence 2nd approach seems better). Start populating them along existing ones (so microsite is sending them). Then we change email templates to use them.

Does it make sense? If so we need card on trello board.

m.

________________________________
From: Andrew Barash
Sent: Thursday, October 22, 2015 6:57 PM
To: Martin Schwitzner; Marcin Bazydlo; Arca Artem
Cc: Nicky Drake; Jeremy Barry
Subject: Re: Date/Time Field

Hey guys,

The call center brought this issue up recently and I pulled Martin in to discuss making the changes. I realized, though, that we rely on field comparisons (preferred vs confirmed) in order to surface the correct messaging in the confirmation email. In light of this, we have a couple choices:

  *   Change all relevant date/time fields to text values. We’d need to have the reps enter the appropriate confirmed date/time value in text format to match the requested date/time.
  *   Split the combined Date/Time fields to a separate Date field (that doesn’t change based on timezone) and a Time dropdown that has values for the entire day in either 15-minute or 30-minute increments.
  *   …something else?

I prefer option 2, as it doesn’t open the matching to input errors by the reps. For example, 5:00 pm != 5:00PM.

The changes are FAST to make in the Salesforce sandbox, so we can try a few different things if you’d like. Whatever we do, we’ll likely need to adjust the reports to some extent, but we can build formula fields that automatically concatenate the separated fields to a single field upon which we can perform calculations/etc if we need.

Thanks,

Andrew

---

From: Martin Schwitzner Date: Thursday, October 22, 2015 at 10:47 AM
To: Marcin Bazydlo, Arca Artem
Cc: Andrew Barash, Nicky Drake, Jeremy Barry
Subject: Date/Time Field

Hi Marcin,Arca -

We need to change the Date/Time fields for our SF /RB integration to send the info as plain text not a proper time and date. The reason here is that SF changes this field based on the time zone of the agent looking at the case and has and can lead to issues. The agents are aware but mistakes still keep happening so we are better of making this small change here.

It seems to me to be a trivial change? Is this something we can do now or should we plan it for the next sprint?

@Jeremy – I assume this would hit some of our reporting capabilities in terms of looking what times bookings get made for potentially

Thanks,

Martin

cards.desc: If anything to do with filtering offers is updated by a user then the state of the 'offers only' checkbox does not change, but should. For example, if a search is submitted for which is to include only offers, when the search results are loaded the 'offers only' checkbox is not highlighted, but should be. Another example is – after a user has selected the 'offers only' checkbox filter on the search results page – when the user deselects the 'All offers' checkbox from the dropdown filter list, the 'offers only' checkbox is not updated to reflect the deselected state, but should be.

cards.desc:
From: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>
Date: Tuesday, August 2, 2016 at 10:57 AM
 
We have noticed a little issue around importing offers details into ExactTarget. Basically, any sort of line breaks get removed, and the last word of one line and the first word of the next line get merged into each other (see below for examples). As you can see from the email chain below, when the data arrives with the DAG team, the line breaks are already missing. Can you take a look at how the data gets passed on from your end, and if there is a way we can either directly transmit the line breaks or put in some sort of placeholder character that identifies where a line break is supposed to be?
 
===

From: Joseph Lee
Re: The line breaks – DAG is not seeing line breaks in their tables.
 
This can be caused by 2 issues:
1)      When storing, the line breaks are not being stored.
a.       If this is the case, we’d ask the offers engineers to add an escape character or the html equivalent for line breaks
2)      There’s a script that pulls in the information. It was made by the offers team and it may be stripping instances of the line breaks.
a.       If this is the case, we’d request whoever sent us the script to adjust to store the line-breaks
cards.name: How the data gets passed from PO API to ExactTarget via DAG

attachments.name: #5 Replace linebreaks/carriage returns with html linebreak

From: Leanne McGirr <lmcgirr@opentable.com<mailto:lmcgirr@opentable.com>>
Date: Wednesday, 4 November 2015 at 10:45
To: John Catterfeld <jcatterfeld@opentable.com<mailto:jcatterfeld@opentable.com>>
Subject: Christmas parties landing page

Hey John,

I wanted to talk to you about the xmas parties landing page that we usually have on .co.uk. This is another example of a page that we used to run via charm but needs to move across to the m/ pages. I think we may have spoken about this weeks ago around the time we talked about taste but it fell off the radar a bit.

The page is essentially a landing page for all of our Christmas comms and links off to all relevant promo pages (Xmas Eve, Xmas Day, NYE, Great for groups, Wow factor dining, Private dining’. It’s mainly images with a little bit of copy.

Maria has been working on a design, and we think we could have everything ready this week. I know that you guys are snowed under with Australia work, would Totty have any time over the next few weeks to take a look at this page? It’s something we need urgently, but sometime this month would be helpful. Maybe we could grab 5mins to talk through?

Cheers,
Leanne McGirr

Hey guys,

cgould:$ curl -I http://media.opentable.com.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/m/.well-known/assetlinks.json

Chris

"Hi Mattia,
 
There is another odd thing we noticed in the process of setting up today’s newsletter. Not sure if this is something you work on, but maybe you can forward it to the correct person on the engineering side otherwise.
 
We wanted to link diners to a promo page such as this example (this still works correctly):
http://www.opentable.co.uk/promo.aspx?m=72&ref=13256&pid=816
 
But then we wanted to apply sorting (e.g. by popularity) or filtering (e.g. only restaurants in a certain price category) and include that in the link:
http://www.opentable.co.uk/promo.aspx?metroid=72&sort=Popularity&excludefields=Description&promoid=816&ref=13256&pricebandids=2
 
This works OK if I do it myself on the site, but if I click the link above to go directly to the pre-filtered page, I get automatically redirected to some other list. That list shows me a lot of restaurants which are not on that promo page and not even within the London metro…any idea what is going on here?
 
Cheers
 
Moritz"

cards.desc:
When booking a restaurant that has offers and 1000-points, the reservation will get both even if consumer chooses offer instead of POP. 

The expected behaviour is:
- Consumer books with an offer --> Restaurant is reserved with offer, AND consumer gets 100 points
- Consumer books with POP --> Restaurant is reserved as usual, AND consumer gets 1000 points

Actual:
- Consumer books with an offer --> Restaurant is reserved with offer, AND *consumer gets 1000 points*
- Consumer books with POP --> Restaurant is reserved as usual, AND consumer gets 1000 points
cards.name: BUG - Booking flow allows restaurant bookings with both offers and POP

cards.desc:
From: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>
Date: Monday, July 18, 2016 at 2:09 PM
To: OMG <OMG@opentable.com>
Subject: Issue with German test offers import

Hi guys,
 
There seems to be a slight issue with importing the test offers for Germany into our email service provider ExactTarget. The offers for each market should be imported into a file called Offers_NA, Offers_UK, Offers_DE and so on (and each of these files are located in different sub-accounts for each country within ExactTarget, so we can’t just easily pull information form a UK file into a German email etc.). However, somehow UK and German offers both get imported into the UK offers file, while nothing gets imported into the DE file (NA seems to be working fine at first glance). I have attached the export of the current list of offers in the Offers_UK file, this includes the German offers that should not be in there (e.g. Offer ID 166176). Looks like the “country” field is set to UK somehow, even though Miwa and I set this test offer up via German OTRC for a German test restaurant on Friday.
cards.name: DE Offers lists imported into ExactTarget go under a file called "Offers_UK" instead of "Offers_DE"

There is a bug on the US profile page. If you click on the Promotions tab it doesn’t go anywhere any more (and just noticed it doesn’t work on the UK page either) e.g.
http://www.opentable.com/canyon-creek-front-street

---

This is because there are two elements on the page with id=special-offers, so the link doesn’t know what to scroll to.

The additional element has the class 'special-offers-expanded’ and is hidden with the ab-testing-hide class. We should rename the corresponding ID to special-offers-expanded too.

cards.desc:
Bill reported this issue:

Hi Arca,
 
As I was checking the system this morning I found an error in the PO API which has been going on for a long time – it wasn’t introduced with the latest build.  It looks like the PO service is throwing an exception when trying to access the offers cache.  Here’s a stack trace:
 
System.Exception: {"Message":"An error has occurred.","ExceptionMessage":"Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection.\r\nParameter name: index","ExceptionType":"System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException","StackTrace":"   at System.ThrowHelper.ThrowArgumentOutOfRangeException()\r\n   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1.get_Item(Int32 index)\r\n   at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()\r\n   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)\r\n   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)\r\n   at OpenTable.Services.PromotedOffer.DataAccess.Repositories.AvailabilityRepository.MapToDto(DataTable dataTable, AvailableOffersQuery availableOffersQuery, List`1 knownOffers) in c:\\BuildAgent\\work\\703516434a0a57f\\DataAccess\\Repositories\\AvailabilityRepository.cs:line 51\r\n   at OpenTable.Services.PromotedOffer.Domain.Services.PromotedOffersService.GetAvailableOffers(AvailableOffersQuery availableOffersQuery, IQueryOptions queryOptions) in c:\\BuildAgent\\work\\703516434a0a57f\\Domain\\Services\\PromotedOffersService.cs:line 89\r\n   at OpenTable.Services.PromotedOffer.Domain.DirectAccess.AvailableOffersDomainQueries.GetAvailableOffers(AvailableOffersQuery availableOffersQuery, IQueryOptions queryOptions) in c:\\BuildAgent\\work\\703516434a0a57f\\Domain\\DirectAccess\\AvailableOffersDomainQueries.cs:line 22\r\n   at OpenTable.Services.PromotedOffer.Domain.DirectAccess.DomainQueries.GetAvailableOffers(AvailableOffersQuery availableOffersQuery, IQueryOptions options) in c:\\BuildAgent\\work\\703516434a0a57f\\Domain\\DirectAccess\\DomainQueries.cs:line 106\r\n   at OpenTable.Services.PromotedOffer.Api.Controllers.V1.AvailableOffersV1Controller.Post(AvailableOffersQuery availableOffersQuery) in c:\\BuildAgent\\work\\703516434a0a57f\\Api\\Controllers\\V1\\AvailableOffersV1Controller.cs:line 32\r\n
 
I’m only sending you RIDs from the original availability search in the offer availability search, and at this point I’m only selecting the subset which you’ve told me are offer-enabled.  Can you guys possibly quiet this down noise a little bit?  Here’s a dashboard which I’ve saved that gives you a 7-day sample.
 
http://kibana.otenv.com/kibana/#/dashboard/elasticsearch/Arca-PO-index-error
 
Thanks
Bill

cards.desc:
While investigating missing offer details in confirmation emails for Germany, we become aware of a potential issue: 

TMS talks to legacy PromotedOffers API (.NET), and only to the one in EU region. As is, the legacy api is only aware of offers in the region where the service is hosted (eg. API in EU ==> can respond with offers in EU countries only, API in US ==> offers in US ..etc)

TMS team has a backlog item to stop consuming legacy api and migrate to the newer, region agnostic one.
cards.name: Offer details in confirmation emails potentially missing for markets in Asia

cards.desc:
We believe the recent SEO drop off in many restaurants was due to listing restaurants not being part of search results in any shape or form. As more ( high search volume ) restaurants moved to listing. 

Below follows the desired behaviour for restaurants in listing status: 

- appear in single searches
-appear in multi-searches- always regardless of the sorting order BEHIND any restaurants with availability (OT or Request Bookings) 
- appear in the All restaurants in [METRO] page
-be linked in the sitemap

All of this should be based on a status set as "ACTIVE" and Restaurant Type set as "OT Listing".

*From*: Sasha Nelson
*Date*: Friday, 23 October 2015 at 18:05
*To*: Lion Ziper
*Cc*: John Catterfeld , Matt Jarjoura , Martin Schwitzner
*Subject*: Re: Issues with photocenter

(moving Alexa to bcc)

Hi Lion,

Thanks for sending screenshots. I agree, the widescreen photos look strange and this is not how the photo gallery is meant to look. However I'm unable to reproduce your issue on Chrome, Safari, or Firefox. When I visit this restaurant's profile, I only see square images (no widescreen). Can you give us more info on your browser, etc?

Matt and John, any ideas why this is happening?

Thanks,
Sasha

PS: In the future we don't need to ask restaurants to resize images down to 512x512. This is just our minimum pixel size – if they have a version that's even higher resolution that is preferred! (Our max constraint is 15 MB).

________________________________
From: Lion Ziper
Sent: Friday, October 23, 2015 1:00 AM
To: Alexa Andrzejewski
Cc: Sasha Nelson
Subject: Issues with photocenter

Hi Sasha,

Hi Alexa,

please have a look at the profile of the Consilium Köln (RID 13368). I’ve uploaded a few pictures. The webdesigner sent me pictures which he compressed to 512 x 512 pxl. At photo center they are displayed correctly but please see the pictures attached how those photos are displayed on the customers OT profile. One half of the picture is missing (widescreen) and the quality is really low.

The customer complained about this and prefers not to have any pictures instead of keeping those on his profile. He doesn’t understand, why we want the pictures to have 512 x 512 pxl if we then compress them to 320 x 180 pxl.

Could you please let me know, if there is any chance to fix this.

Many thanks in advance.

Kind regards from Frankfurt.

Lion Ziper

cards.desc:
Lucy got in touch with us about offers appearing on a restaurant restref path where it shouldn't. We couldn't replicate the issue on our end, however our investigation revealed a potential intermittent issue in ConsumerWeb where on  occasion, it may ignore exclusivity rules and display it regardless of what's been setup in the editor.

Lucy believes the opposite is true, but from what I can gather, the basic rule of offer exclusivity seems to be **"Available everywhere unless exclusivity specified explicitly (w/ some nuances)"** (@ndrake, is this compatible with your knowledge of offers?)

The rules governing exclusivity is not centralised (could be a consequence of caching or other requirements by services consuming PO APIs) but I believe the rules in the PO API should be the source of truth. 

-----------

Email from Lucy Taylor:

For Ye Olde Sun Inn
 
**103020** (www.opentable.co.uk/restaurant/profile/103020)

**From**: Hannah Allan 
**Date**: Wednesday, 14 October 2015 10:38
**To**: Nicky Drake
**Cc**: David Hamilton 
**Subject**: Quick Query

Hi Nicky,

I’m hoping you can help here.

David and I met with Burberry yesterday (they have a restaurant called Thomas’s which I manage).

They want to know if the box that is default ticked to receive an email address can be default unticked, so that the customer has to tick it to opt in? They’re very privacy conscious you see.

Thanks.

Kindest regards,
Hannah
cards.name: Email address can be default unticked

cards.desc:
From: Sasha Nelson
Date: Thursday, 16 October 2014 00:26
To: Cornered Badgers
Subject: QA for DFF Pages

Hey Guys,

Still QA'ing but here are a few things I noticed so far:  

1) Review Header - when you go over the character limit the red highlight looks a bit low (see screenshot)

2) Review nickname - we should probably add a character limit counter here so diners know not to go beyond 25

3) Private Note - when you go over the max character limit red highlighting looks funny - e.g. not at the end of my text or sometimes at the end but not when count hits -1 (see screenshots) 

4) Email validation alert looks wonky – should observe new treatment - e.g. red border around box with alert message in red above the field

That's all for now! Please let me know if this is unclear. Thanks!

data.text:

To follow up with Nagesh.

card.name: PromotedOffer DataSync is faulty for IE Offer Types
card.desc:
IE Offer Types have wrong Locale in MongoDB due to faulty sync. DataSync process incorrectly identifies locale as 'en-GB' instead of the correct 'en-IE' locale

This line is the culprit:
https://github.com/opentable/PromotedOffer/blob/c56cf9f3ce25b9cafa5dc7af53f750e74337b26f/DataAccess/Mappers/LocaleConverter.cs#L22-L23

card.name: D&D Evening Standard offers doesn't appear on RestRef path
card.desc:
Evening Standard special offers on 2 restaurants doesn't show on the RestRef path

##To replicate

- Navigate to http://southplacehotel.com/
- Click 'Book a table' on top right corner
- Select either **Angler (RID: 92148)** or **South Place Chop House (RID: 92145)** from the drop down
- Select 22nd August 2016 at 20:00 for 2 people
- Click 'Find Table'

Expected: OpenTable RestRef page with availability having ES special offer
Actual: OpenTable RestRef page with availability without ES special offer


##Example URLs that shows the issue

http://www.opentable.co.uk/r/south-place-chop-house-reservations-london?restref=92145&datetime=2016-08-22T20%3A00&covers=2&searchdatetime=2016-08-22T20%3A00&partysize=2

http://www.opentable.co.uk/angler-reservations-london?restref=92148&datetime=2016-08-22T20%3A00&covers=2&searchdatetime=2016-08-22T20%3A00&partysize=2

##ES Special Offers

South Place Chop House (92145) ES Special: http://offerseditor.otcorp.opentable.com/Offer/Edit?id=166149

Angler (92148) ES Special: http://offerseditor.otcorp.opentable.com/Offer/Edit?id=166929

board.name: OMG - Global offers and International Growth

card.name: Modification path on a booking with an offer missing offers

data.text:
# Description

## Issue

Good morning Lucy, Melissa,
 
I hope that you are well. 
 
I am afraid that when the guests book through opentable for the deal, they receive an email confirmation about the deal and on our system it is flagged.
 
But, if the guest then goes back into their booking on opentable and changes the time, in our system the deal disappears.
 
We have tested this several times to double check and I am afraid that we always get the same result.
 
I look forward to hearing back from you.
 
With kind regards, 

## Workaround

Hi Lucy,
 
This is a known issue. The temporary workaround is for the customer to cancel the reservation and rebook. They’ll then be able to select the offer. I’ll have to talk to Miwa & Mattia for a more permanent fix
 
Regards,
Arca

card.name: Reporting Discrepancy
card.desc:
# Description

Hello all,

We're seeing some odd numbers and a very large discrepancy when we at the inventory availability through DFP compared to the Adobe site level reports.

Per Adobe reporting, it looks like there are 5-6MM PV on Desktop, and 3MM PV on Mobile.  

DESKTOP
When I pull the impression availability in DFP, I see only 1.4MM available impressions in the 300x100 which should be on all pages except for the Complete Reservation page.  We're somehow not filling, or missing tags on ~3MM page views on desktop.  

MOBILE
We're seeing a similar issue with mobile as well.  On Mobile, I see only 400K available impressions, but given that the ad should be on the Rest Prof and Confirm page, we should be seeing more available impressions?  

Given that these are large discrepancies, I'd love to figure out a solution as soon as possible.

Can you confirm that the tags are indeed on every page?  

Would it be possible to set up a dev log in or similar so I can inspect the ad tag on page, to ensure it's functioning correctly?  The current set up does not allow me to view the source ad tag.

We're also open to any suggestions you might have so that we can resolve.

Let me know if I can assist with anything as well.

Thank you!

card.name: How to "Acceptance Criteria"
card.desc:
# Proposed workflow

- add a card to the backlog

- add the "missing acceptance criteria" sticker to the card (see above)

- remove the "missing acceptance criteria" sticker once acceptance criteria has been added to a card

- before moving the card into the **This sprint (prioritised)** or the **In progress column** make sure it has the "acceptance criteria" checklist (see example below)

- when the card is in the **Awaiting sign-off** column the person responsible for validating it should verify and check all the criteria before moving it into **Completed**

board.name: OMG - Global offers and International Growth

card.name: How the data gets passed from PO API to ExactTarget via DAG
card.desc:
From: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>
Date: Tuesday, August 2, 2016 at 10:57 AM
 
We have noticed a little issue around importing offers details into ExactTarget. Basically, any sort of line breaks get removed, and the last word of one line and the first word of the next line get merged into each other (see below for examples). As you can see from the email chain below, when the data arrives with the DAG team, the line breaks are already missing. Can you take a look at how the data gets passed on from your end, and if there is a way we can either directly transmit the line breaks or put in some sort of placeholder character that identifies where a line break is supposed to be?
 
===

From: Joseph Lee
Re: The line breaks – DAG is not seeing line breaks in their tables.
 
This can be caused by 2 issues:
1)      When storing, the line breaks are not being stored.
a.       If this is the case, we’d ask the offers engineers to add an escape character or the html equivalent for line breaks
2)      There’s a script that pulls in the information. It was made by the offers team and it may be stripping instances of the line breaks.
a.       If this is the case, we’d request whoever sent us the script to adjust to store the line-breaks

old.desc:
From: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>
Date: Tuesday, August 2, 2016 at 10:57 AM
To: OMG <OMG@opentable.com>
Cc: Joseph Lee <joseph.lee@opentable.com>, Savitha Anantharam <sanantharam@opentable.com>
Subject: FW: Issue with test offers data import into ET

Hi guys,
 
We have noticed a little issue around importing offers details into ExactTarget. Basically, any sort of line breaks get removed, and the last word of one line and the first word of the next line get merged into each other (see below for examples). As you can see from the email chain below, when the data arrives with the DAG team, the line breaks are already missing. Can you take a look at how the data gets passed on from your end, and if there is a way we can either directly transmit the line breaks or put in some sort of placeholder character that identifies where a line break is supposed to be?
 
Happy to come over and have a chat if you need more details.
 
Cheers
 
Moritz

board.name: OMG - Global offers and International Growth

card.name: How the data gets passed from PO API to ExactTarget via DAG
card.desc:
From: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>
Date: Tuesday, August 2, 2016 at 10:57 AM
To: OMG <OMG@opentable.com>
Cc: Joseph Lee <joseph.lee@opentable.com>, Savitha Anantharam <sanantharam@opentable.com>
Subject: FW: Issue with test offers data import into ET

Hi guys,
 
We have noticed a little issue around importing offers details into ExactTarget. Basically, any sort of line breaks get removed, and the last word of one line and the first word of the next line get merged into each other (see below for examples). As you can see from the email chain below, when the data arrives with the DAG team, the line breaks are already missing. Can you take a look at how the data gets passed on from your end, and if there is a way we can either directly transmit the line breaks or put in some sort of placeholder character that identifies where a line break is supposed to be?
 
Happy to come over and have a chat if you need more details.
 
Cheers
 
Moritz

From: Leanne McGirr <lmcgirr@opentable.com>
Date: Friday, July 29, 2016 at 10:55 AM
To: Miwa Ahlstrom <mahlstrom@opentable.com>, Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>, Joseph Lee <joseph.lee@opentable.com>, Savitha Anantharam <sanantharam@opentable.com>

Leanne McGirr

lmcgirr@opentable.com
cid:aa68f54d-f880-443b-8424-8ad4b2e5aaf5
 
From: Miwa Ahlstrom 
Sent: 29 July 2016 09:36
To: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>; Joseph Lee <joseph.lee@opentable.com>; Leanne McGirr <lmcgirr@opentable.com>; Savitha Anantharam <sanantharam@opentable.com>
Subject: Re: Issue with test offers data import into ET
 
As this is ExactTarget and possibly DAG issues, I'm moving OMG to Bcc. Please reach out to us if there's any issue related to PO API.
 
Thanks!
Miwa
From: Moritz Schorr
Sent: Friday, July 29, 2016 9:31:19 AM
To: Joseph Lee; Leanne McGirr; Savitha Anantharam
Cc: OMG
Subject: RE: Issue with test offers data import into ET
 
Ok thanks. So would a comma in any of the text also break it? It seems that one of the offers does not have any quotation marks, but still does not get imported…it does have a comma in there however.
 
Leanne is updating the existing offers and asking the sales teams to avoid quotation marks going forward.
 
From: Joseph Lee 
Sent: 28 July 2016 20:54
To: Moritz Schorr <mschorr@opentable.com>; Leanne McGirr <lmcgirr@opentable.com>; Savitha Anantharam <sanantharam@opentable.com>
Cc: OMG <OMG@opentable.com>
Subject: RE: Issue with test offers data import into ET
 
When the file comes over to us, we digest the information separated by commas and it accepts information within quotation marks. This is done so that when you have information with commas, it won’t separate the information.
 
I don’t think it’s something we can fix on our end. The only thing to watch out for are quotation marks.
Can the sales team update those values?

data.text:
**Update**

- I took a look at this ticket, and found a test restaurant which matches all relevant criteria. Restaurant details below:

>**Name** - Aqua Nueva
>**RID** - 81331
>**System** - GuestCenter 
>**CreditCard Enabled** - true
>**PromotedOffers** - true
>**Offer ID** - 164841

- Making a reservation with the offer was possible, and the confirmation email included the offer correctly. However, it seems that the offer does not appear in Guest Centre. Screenshots were taken through each part of the booking and have been attached to card. A full list of screenshots is below.

>aqua-nueva-booking-details.jpg
>aqua-nueva-booking-confirmation.jpg
>aqua-nueva-confirmation-email.jpg
>aqua-nueva-guestcenter.jpg
>aqua-nueva-otrc-offers-editor.jpg

card.name: SPIKE - Image Creation for Points Module

data.text:
**Update**

- The points module for TMS contains a progress bar, which includes details about the diners points; e.g. their balance and the points linked to the booking (whether they are earning or spending points).

- Due to the limitations of most email clients, we need to render this progress bar as an image, and not with html.

- This ticket is simply to take a spike into the efforts required in building an image generator that can be used to create these images.

data.text:
**Update** 

- The PRs for the DeployToS3 repository have been merged in. 

- To test they were working, I kicked off a build for the jp/m/ pages, and checked to make sure that files were correctly coming back as either JSON or SVG files. The snippets below show this to be working as expected.

```
curl -I https://s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/media.opentable.jp/m/img/badge-ios.svg
```

```
curl -I https://s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/media.opentable.jp/m/.well-known/assetlinks.json
```

- Feeling confident that the update had fixed this issue, I kicked off the builds for all remaining domains (COM / COMAU / COMMX / COUK / DE / IE / JP), and can safely say all are working as expected, without issue.

- The full list of JSON files Christopher Gould required are detailed below and have been tested working.

```
curl -I https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/media.opentable.co.uk/m/.well-known/assetlinks.json
curl -I https://s3.amazonaws.com/media.opentable.com/m/.well-known/assetlinks.json
curl -I https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/media.opentable.de/m/.well-known/assetlinks.json
curl -I https://s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/media.opentable.jp/m/.well-known/assetlinks.json
```

- Moving this ticket to 'Awaiting sign-off'.

cc @arcaartem / @mrichetto / @jcatterfeld

checkItem.name: what happens after updating the deploy script (w/ a PR)?

card.name: s3 files have wrong content type

board.name: OMG - Global offers and International Growth

data.text:
**Update**

- Paired with @arcaartem to investigate this further. 

- Using a [test S3 bucket created by Maxime](https://opentable.atlassian.net/browse/TECHOPS-451), we were able to run the same powershell script linked [here](https://github.com/opentable/DeployToS3/blob/master/PowerShellDeploy/deployToS3.ps1). 

- Running the script locally, we could see that it was not working as expected, with the content type for svg and json files still showing incorrectly as 'application/octet-stream'.

- To fix this, we updated the deply files to the ones included in the latest PowerShell SDK.

- Two separate PRs were created for this work. One for updating the SDK files, and another to make sure json files were set the correct content type. Both PRs are linked to this card.

- Once the changes are merged in, we'll test this to make sure everything goes through team city correctly. 

cc @arcaartem / @mrichetto

data.text:
@mrichetto - I would agree that this is the correct file.

Before making any changes, I'd double check with Colby regarding the international links. 

Most languages have direct articles about points, and I've linked them below. 

**US** - https://community.opentable.com/t5/Dining-Rewards-Points/What-are-OpenTable-Dining-Rewards-amp-Points/ta-p/109
**GB** - https://community.opentable.com/t5/FAQs-Knowledge-Base/What-are-OpenTable-points/ta-p/670
**FR** - https://community.opentable.com/t5/Foire-aux-questions/Comment-puis-je-accumuler-des-points-de-r%C3%A9compense/ta-p/19822
(There doesn't seem to be an equivalent 'What are OpenTable points' for the French pages, this is the nearest one).
**DE** - https://community.opentable.com/t5/Fragen-Wissensbank/Was-sind-OpenTable-Punkte/ta-p/994
**JP** - https://community.opentable.com/t5/FAQ-%E3%82%88%E3%81%8F%E3%81%82%E3%82%8B%E3%81%94%E8%B3%AA%E5%95%8F/OpenTable-%E3%83%9D%E3%82%A4%E3%83%B3%E3%83%88%E3%81%AB%E3%81%A4%E3%81%84%E3%81%A6%E6%95%99%E3%81%88%E3%81%A6%E3%81%8F%E3%81%A0%E3%81%95%E3%81%84/ta-p/18768
**ES** - https://community.opentable.com/t5/Preguntas-Frecuentes-y-Base-de/Que-son-los-Puntos-OpenTable/ta-p/60610

With regards to IE and AU, neither domain offers reward points to diners, so we don't need to worry about those links.

card.name: Update "Offers/Angebote" product name to "Specials" for Germany

data.text:
Hi Tom

As well as OpenTable Consumer Web - Redesign, Email Subscription Box, OpenTable- Search results /​ SEO Landing Pages (Micro Site) and Start Page Home & RestProfile (all of which you already have access to), Specials => Angebote also appears in the following projects (which you don't yet have access to):

- Search Results Node
- Consumer iOS
- Restaurant Community Database
- Marketing - Business Docs (Word,​ Excel,​ PPT,​ InDesign)
- OpenTable Mobile Web
- GC [Guest Center] - iOS
- OpenTable - Android
- OpenTable Consumer iOS

( @miwa505 here is the link to the search result: http://bit.ly/2a6GSeF)

Guidance is needed on:
- what to do with projects outside your purview (i.e. do I/Miwa make these changes and liaise with the product/project owners to have the changes deployed, or do we request that they make and deploy the changes themselves?)
- what to do with strings where "Special offers" is translated as 'Spezialangeboten' (2 examples) or 'Sonderangeboten' (16 examples)

BR

Robert

card.name: Update "Offers/Angebote" product name to "Specials" for Germany
card.desc:
Based on the survey and internal discussions, we will be calling Offers in Germany "Specials". We need to update the "translation" everywhere "Offers" appear.

Wenn ein Restaurant ein besonderes Menü über OpenTable anbieten würde, welcher dieser Begriffe würde Sie am meisten interessieren und zum Reservieren anregen?
·         Specials                                               28.8%
·         Besondere Erlebnisse                    22.7%
·         Besondere Angebote                     16.3%
·         Angebote                                            9.9%
·         Spezielle Angebote                         19.1%
·         Other suggestion                             3.3%
 
 
Suggestions for ‘other’
·         Exklusiv für Opentable-Kunden (exclusive for OT customers)
·         Open Table Specials
·         Feinschmecker (gourmet)
·         Top Angebote nur für Dich (top offers just for you)
·         Brunch
·         Menü des Tages oder wir empfehlen heute (menu of the day or today’s recommendations)
·         Schmankerl (Bavarian specific term – something special)
·         Besondere Gaumenfreuden (Treats to tickle your tastebuds)

[Additionally...]

We seem to have an issue impacting OTRC in Germany. No offers are displaying in OTRC, even though offers have been added. I am seeing this issue and Sandra was able to replicate it. card.name: DE - No offers are displaying in OTRC
card.desc:
We seem to have an issue impacting OTRC in Germany. No offers are displaying in OTRC, even though offers have been added. I am seeing this issue and Sandra was able to replicate it. This is impacting all 4 restaurants with live offers. I have confirmed the team have only been using OTRC to upload offers. Example below for Cantinetta Ristorante. FYI restaurants with offers in Hamburg are:

- Cantinetta Ristorante - RID: 101631
- Restaurant Slowman – RID: 110832
- Red Chamber – RID: 104307
- Kajüte – RID: 107496
